_exec_summary.SummaryText:
J.M. PRODUCTS, INC., 3117 JOSHUA, LITTLE ROCK, ARKANSAS  72204

EPA ID # 1000-0006-3441



FACILITY DESCRIPTION, REGULATED SUBSTANCE, ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:



J.M. Products owns a manufacturing facility that produces a variety of hair products, including Isoplus?, Upturn?, Black Magic?, Oil of K?, and Healthy Solutions? Plus. In the manufacturing processes, J.M. Products utilizes three regulated flammable mixtures (A-46, A31/152a:6436 and D-152/A-31) in quantities that exceed EPA?s threshold of 10,000 pounds. A-46 is composed of Isobutane and Propane, and A31/152a as well as D-152/A-31 is composed of Isobutane and Difluoroethane. J.M. Products? commitment to providing a safe, healthy work environment for employees as well as providing a safe, healthy environment for the surrounding community is supported by the development and implementation of an accidental release prevention program. 



J.M. Products? policy in the event of an uncontrolled accidental release of a flammable mixture is to evacuate the facility immediately and to contact the local fire department as well as the local emergency agencies.  J.M. Products adheres to all applicable Federal, State and local safety and environmental regulations for the prevention of releases of these flammable mixtures of chemicals.





ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM:



J.M. Products complies with the Level 3 Prevention Program of EPA?s standard 40 CFR 68, or Risk Management Plan (RMP) Program through compliance with OSHA?s Process Safety Management Program (29 CFR 1910.119), or PSM Program. The PSM Program is an extensive prevention program that was developed to prevent hazardous chemical releases. The PSM Plan is a comprehensive program with fourteen elements, including process hazard analysis, employee training, hot work procedures, incident investigations, operating procedures, mechanical integrity, pre-safety startup, contractor safety, emergency planning and response,

compliance auditing, and employee participation. 



The PSM Program ensures that the process and the equipment in the process is designed, constructed, and maintained according to industry codes and standards and that the process is operated according to good engineering practices. The mechanical integrity element of the program includes scheduled inspections and tests of equipment and monitoring devices in the process to detect any deficiencies or defects in equipment. Preventative maintenance and replacement policies of parts and equipment ensure that deficiencies are addressed and corrected before they could potentially contribute to a release incident. All elements of the PSM Program help to ensure that uncontrolled releases of the propellant mixtures are prevented.





FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:



J.M. Products has had one accidental release of propellant in the past five years.  The event involved a release of approximately 86 pounds of propellant, which lead to an explosion and fire.  No onsite or offsite deaths, or injuries occurred.  No offsite evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage occurred as a result of the release event.  The release resulted in a fire which caused significant property damage to one section of the building.  



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:



J.M. Products has developed an emergency response plan (in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.38) that includes provisions to evacuate the facility in the event of an uncontrolled release of either flammable mixture. J.M. Products has coordinated with the local emergency planning committee on its emergency response plan, and in the unlikely event of an uncontrolled release, the local fire department will be contact and they will respond to the release.





PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:



J.M. Products is committed to continuous efforts to improve the safe operation of the flammable mixtures process by implementing preventative maintenance programs, inspection

programs, and employee training in the safe operation of the equipment and the system. J.M. Products process incorporated additional process controls for the prevention of releases, which were completed on December 8, 1999. In addition, new equipment, process controls, ventilation systems and alarms are currently being installed with estimated completion of construction in April 2008.  Periodic auditing of the PSM Program ensures that the program is implemented properly. The management of change procedures ensures that any system changes or modifications are evaluated and necessary safety precautions and or safety improvements are made before the process is placed into operation.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY - CONTINUED









EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
